Feedbin_Level: Nearly empty at end of shift
Notes: Bottom knife gate movement began rough but cleared up | Vibrator pressure was changed from 20 to 40 PSI upon pre-steam xfer chute clogging

Signs_Pre-Steam_Bin_Chute_Clogging: Started clogging at end of shift and still trying to clear it up
Notes: At end of shift pre-steam transfer conveyor started to clog while running at 100% and still working through it | Bumped vibrator pressure up to 60 PSI

Signs_Pre-Steam_Bin_Chute_Clogging: Two major clogs which led to shut down
Notes: Slowed pre-steam livebottoms down to 90% and had no problems after that change | Ran plug screw at 135% the entire shift which shows that biomass not moving fast enough

Signs_Pre-Steam_Bin_Chute_Clogging: Clogged once and caused a shut down
Notes: Top knife gate flush system working with a high squeal noise every time closes | Gear drive temps good | The hydrolyzer discharge conveyor gear drive was a little hot at 125 F | Clogged very badly while running at 90% on the pre-steam bottoms | Upon restart ran at 80% and kept a high level in the pre-steam bin | The level in the presteam bin was maintained using the camera | The level indicator cannot be trusted | Ran great up to 21:00 | First time blowing boiler down while in a campaign | Did three valve cycles but pressure in METSO dropped significantly | Should do only one very brief cycle in the future

Boiler: Good except during blow down when shut down
Notes: Top knife gate movement had problems closings periodically
Vibrator pressure was 80 PSI for several hours then 20 PSI for remainder of shift

First time using the new resurfaced ball valves | The top valve was set up with the double acting ACTREG actuator but it was closing incredibly slow | It took between 10-11 seconds to fully close | The bottom valve used the spring loaded actuator and worked quite well | It was taking between 2-3 seconds to fully open and close

Potable water supply to the plant randomly quit | Tried switching seals over to process water but filters clogged immediately | The bushing for the acid inlet into METSO failed | Threads were eaten up even though it was SS | Ball valves overall worked great for Campaign 9

Began taking actuator on top ball valve shut down and discovered a piece of aluminum in the air inlet on the close side |  Removed piece and reinstalled ball valve |  Began working fine once reinstalled | Mistakenly installed ball valve closed with acutator in the open position | Once engaged it sheared a marker stud shut down | Immediately stopped to fix and ran with no problems

Override was shut down for level of liquefaction and presteam livebottoms | We got a spike in level for the liquefaction tank and shut down the presteam livebottoms which nearly blew the plug | Presteam level reading 95% but the visual level through the camera shows it being very low

The hydrolyzer discharge screw's gear drive shear pin broke at random | Caused the shaft to stop moving and the motor to free spin | The HMI indicated no problems | Amps looked a little flatter than usual but nothing significantly noticeable | The pressure at the end of the hydrolyzer started increasing and the temp started decreasing | Shortly after that was noticed the amps on the hydrolyzer started rising slowly | About 20 minutes went by before realized the hydrolyzer discharge was shut down
NA
Steam leak in acid inlet to the T-pipe | The acid pump was also giving much trouble | Had to increase stroke length from 50% to 80%
NA
See notes for this date on Start Up Summary for issues that occurred
Squeezing rate was very slow | For 10 hours of squeezing only filled the conical section about 3/4 of the way up or about 35 gallons

Soon after it looked like a plug was forming on start up and the amps dived down on the PSF | Cranked up the vibrator to 80 PSI and reduced the PSF to 80% speed | Amps eventually went back up but  same thing happened right before shift turnpver at 16:00 | The pre-steam transfer conveyor never showed any struggle | The only worry was the low amps on the PSF | Increasing vibrator pressure seemed to help but it as hard to tell | Once the amps went back up the vibrator was turned back to 60 PSI | The bottom ball valves squeals when opening and closing and think it's the actuator

Signs_Pre-Steam_Bin_Chute_Clogging: Clogged once and caused a shut down
Notes: The bottom ball valve is making high pitched noises when opening and closing | Might be the seat and ball catching and releasing

Bottom_Ball_Valve: Same as prior shift and not worse
Notes: Squeezing rate is about 2% per hour in the C5 tank | Started squeezing residual cake with small screw press on the ground | getting about 7.5 gallons per hour | Steam leak by acid inlet is slowly getting worse

Bottom_Ball_Valve: Same as prior shift and not worse
Notes: Almost clogged and decreased screw speeds and ran it out | Vibrator went to 80 PSI for about 40 minutes

The hydrolyzer discharger tripped itself immediately after a large amperage spike was witnessed in the control room | The shear pin was still intact | Reversed the screw and unclogged whatever caused the amp spike | The top ball valve actuator diaphragm busted wide open during shutdown | It was the actreg double acting actuator | The plan is to install the spare spring loaded actuator first thing next week | Then operating two spring acting actuators | The bottom ball valve noise has been solved | It was due to a dry indicator shaft on the actuator

Top ball valve good after the initial problem at start up | The differential was too high for the seal gauges so switched flow direction | Seal water filter outlet pressure too low | Need to clean out screens soon
Large piece of wood debris clogged metal detector chute | The cablevey 2 cable discs were broken
Squeeze rate is very slow

Squeezing hydrolysate using the small screw press on the floor | Since the rate of the screw press cannot keep up with the rate of cake out of the system we are saving the cake and going to squeeze for an extended time after we shut down METSO | The reason to not just slow down the METSO throughput is because conditions will be too far from normal and it will add uneeded hours on the machinery | The plug screw amps were all over the place today and dipping down below 9 and then up to 14 | The plug screw speed ranged from 100 to 127%
